name: Alaska SeaLife Center
description: Pressed penny machine near aquarium exhibits.

name: Alaska Zoo
description: Hand‑crank penny press added in 2005 featuring bear, leopard, moose and tiger head designs.

name: Alaska Mint Company
description: Machine inside mint entrance with eagle, grizzly bear, and moose track designs.

name: Cabela’s Anchorage
description: 4‑design hand‑crank inside the large outdoors/hunting store featuring logo, mule deer, elk, bear.

name: Fairbanks Railroad Station
description: Single‑design penny press located at the train depot.

name: Denali Park Village
description: 4‑design machine at visitor village near Denali National Park.

name: Alaska Shirt Company – Juneau
description: Two machines inside shirt shop offering 5 designs each, total 10 designs.

name: Red Dog Saloon – Juneau
description: 4‑design hand‑crank machine just outside gift shop entrance — sled dog team, donkey joke, duck, saloon doors.

name: Ketchikan Mining Co
description: Pressed‑penny machine located at Front Street in Ketchikan mining souvenir shop.

name: Skagway – Glacier Bay Trading / Kone Kompany
description: Pressed‑penny machines located in shops like Glacier Bay Trading and Kone Kompany on Broadway.
